com.oracle.truffle.api.interop

Class KeyInfo

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.oracle.truffle.api.interop.KeyInfo

  • public final class KeyInfo
extends Object
    This class represents key info bit flags. Use this class as a utility to get or set the bit flags when dealing with Message.KEY_INFO message.

    The bit flags have following meaning:

    • 0. bit: Existence of the key
    • 1. bit: Readability of the key (Message.READ is supported)
    • 2. bit: Writability of the key (Message.WRITE is supported)
    • 3. bit: Invocability of the key (Message.createInvoke(int) is supported)
    • 4. bit: Internal attribute of the key (see an internal argument to Message.KEYS)

    When a readable or writable flag is true, it does not necessarily guarantee that subsequent Message.READ or Message.WRITE message will succeed. Read or write can fail due to some momentary bad state. An object field is expected not to be readable resp. writable when it's known that the field can not be read (e.g. a bean property without a getter) resp. can not be written to (e.g. a bean property without a setter). The same applies to invocable flag and invoke message.

    When the key does not exist (0. bit is zero), then all other bits must be zero as well.

    Since:
    0.26

    • Method Detail

      • newBuilder

        public static KeyInfo.Builder newBuilder()
        Create a new bit flags builder. The builder is reusable and builds key info of existing keys only. Use 0 directly to inform about a non-existing key.
